objects.name: NCSC
objects.description: UK National Cyber Security Centre. Author and publisher of this threat report, providing analysis and detection guidance for Pygmy Goat.

objects.name: libsophos.so
objects.description: Malicious shared object deployed by Pygmy Goat for persistence and injection into sshd.

objects.name: .sshd.ipc
objects.description: IPC Unix server socket created by Pygmy Goat for backdoor SSH connections.

objects.name: .fgmon_cli.ipc
objects.description: IPC Unix client socket used by Pygmy Goat, possibly for FortiGate targeting.

objects.name: .goat.ipc
objects.description: IPC Unix server socket from older Pygmy Goat sample.

objects.name: sshdd.pid
objects.description: Single instance pid file used by Pygmy Goat to ensure only one instance runs.

objects.name: goat.pid
objects.description: Single instance pid file from older Pygmy Goat sample.

objects.name: sshd
objects.description: Target process for LD_PRELOAD injection by Pygmy Goat.

objects.name: libsophos.so (LD_PRELOAD)
objects.description: Malicious shared object loaded via LD_PRELOAD for persistence.

objects.name: sh
objects.description: Shell spawned by Pygmy Goat for remote command execution.

objects.name: csh
objects.description: C shell spawned by Pygmy Goat for remote command execution.

objects.name: EarthWorm server
objects.description: Example C2/EarthWorm server domain used in reverse SOCKS proxy functionality.

objects.name: C2 callback (example)
objects.description: Example IPv4 address extracted from decrypted ICMP packet for C2 callback.

objects.name: Indicator for libsophos.so (MD5)
objects.description: MD5 hash of the malicious shared object loaded into /bin/sshd by Pygmy Goat.

objects.name: Indicator for libsophos.so (SHA1)
objects.description: SHA-1 hash of the malicious shared object loaded into /bin/sshd by Pygmy Goat.

objects.name: Indicator for libsophos.so (SHA256)
objects.description: SHA-256 hash of the malicious shared object loaded into /bin/sshd by Pygmy Goat.

objects.name: Indicator for libsophos.so (earlier variant) (MD5)
objects.description: MD5 hash of an earlier variant of the malicious shared object, missing reverse proxy functionality.

objects.name: Indicator for libsophos.so (earlier variant) (SHA1)
objects.description: SHA-1 hash of an earlier variant of the malicious shared object, missing reverse proxy functionality.

objects.name: Indicator for libsophos.so (earlier variant) (SHA256)
objects.description: SHA-256 hash of an earlier variant of the malicious shared object, missing reverse proxy functionality.

objects.name: pygmy goat
objects.description: Pygmy Goat is a native x86-32 ELF shared object discovered on Sophos XG firewall devices, providing backdoor access. It uses LD_PRELOAD to inject into /bin/sshd, hooks the accept function, and listens for ICMP packets to trigger C2 connections. It masquerades as Fortinet using a hardcoded CA certificate, supports remote shell access, packet capture, cron tasks, and reverse SOCKS proxy via EarthWorm. It is designed for Linux devices and achieves persistence by modifying startup scripts to set LD_PRELOAD.

objects.name: libsophos.so
objects.description: Malicious shared object loaded into /bin/sshd as part of Pygmy Goat. It replaces the accept function in sshd, enables backdoor access, and supports C2 communications. Earlier variants lacked reverse proxy functionality and used VMProtect for obfuscation.

objects.name: Fortinet Ltd.
objects.description: Network device vendor whose name and CA certificate are impersonated by Pygmy Goat to establish TLS connections and masquerade as legitimate infrastructure.

objects.name: Sophos
objects.description: Vendor of Sophos XG firewall devices, which were targeted by Pygmy Goat for backdoor access.

objects.name: CrowdStrike
objects.description: Cybersecurity company referenced for reporting on EarthWorm usage by threat actors.

objects.name: Mandiant
objects.description: Cybersecurity company referenced for reporting on attacks against FortiGate devices and similar TTPs to Pygmy Goat.

objects.name: castletap
objects.description: Malware reported by Mandiant targeting FortiGate devices, sharing TTPs with Pygmy Goat such as encrypted ICMP packets containing C2 information for establishing reverse SSL connections.

objects.name: pygmy_goat_aes_key
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.

objects.name: pygmy_goat_magic_strings
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule pygmy_goat_magic_strings
{
meta:
        author = "NCSC"
        description = "Pygmy Goat magic byte sequences used in C2 comms"
        date = "2024-10-22"
        hash1 = "71f70d61af00542b2e9ad64abd2dda7e437536ff"
strings:
$c2_magic_handshake = ",bEB3?=o"
$fake_ssh_banner = "SSH-2.0-D8pjE"
$fake_ed25519_key = { 29 cc f0 cc 16 c5 46 6e 52 19 82 8e 86
65 42 8c 1f 1a d4 c3 a5 b1 cb fc c0 26 6c 31 3c 5c 90 3a 24 7d e4 d3 57
6d da 8e cb f4 66 d1 cb 81 4f 63 fd 4a fa 06 e4 7e 4c a0 95 91 bd cb 97
a4 b3 0f }
condition:
(uint32(0) == 0x464c457f) and any of them
}

objects.name: earthworm_id_generation_x86
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule earthworm_id_generation_x86
{
meta:
        author = "NCSC"
        description = "EarthWorm pool num generation x86 assembly"
        date = "2024-10-22"
        hash1 = "71f70d61af00542b2e9ad64abd2dda7e437536ff"
strings:
$chartoi = {
8b 45 ??        // MOV
c1 e0 07        // SHL
89 c1           // MOV
8b 55 ??        // MOV
8b 45 ??        // MOV
01 d0           // ADD
0f b6 00        // MOVZX
0f be c0        // MOVSX
01 c8           // ADD
89 45 ??        // MOV
83 6d ?? 01     // SUB
EAX,dword ptr [EBP + ??]
EAX,0x7
ECX,EAX
EDX,dword ptr [EBP + ??]
EAX,dword ptr [EBP + ??]
EAX,EDX
EAX,byte ptr [EAX]
EAX,AL
EAX,ECX
dword ptr [EBP + ??],EAX
dword ptr [EBP + ??],0x1
}
condition:
}
(uint32(0) == 0x464c457f) and all of them

objects.name: Dynamic Linker Hijacking
objects.description: Pygmy Goat uses the LD_PRELOAD environment variable to inject into sshd.

objects.name: Command and Scripting Interpreter: Unix Shell
objects.description: Pygmy Goat can create a /bin/sh or /bin/csh remote shell.

objects.name: Scheduled Task/Job: Cron
objects.description: Pygmy Goat can create arbitrary cron tasks using crontab.

objects.name: Inter-Process Communication
objects.description: Pygmy Goat uses Unix sockets for inter-process communication between parent and forked child processes.

objects.name: Network Sniffing
objects.description: Pygmy Goat can use libpcap to sniff network traffic according to a BPF filter and exfiltrate it to the C2.

objects.name: Traffic Signaling: Port Knocking
objects.description: Pygmy Goat listens on an ICMP raw socket for encrypted packets containing magic bytes and the C2 address to connect back to.

objects.name: Data Obfuscation: Protocol Impersonation
objects.description: Pygmy Goat responds to an SSH connection that sends magic bytes with a fake SSH handshake.

objects.name: Encrypted Channel: Asymmetric Cryptography
objects.description: Pygmy Goat encrypts C2 communications with TLS.

objects.name: Protocol Tunneling
objects.description: Pygmy Goat can create a reverse SOCKS5 proxy server to tunnel traffic through it.

objects.name: Archive Collected Data: Archive via Library
objects.description: Pygmy Goat compresses its C2 communications with LZO1X.

objects.name: Exfiltration Over C2 Channel
objects.description: Pygmy Goat exfiltrates its result data over its C2 channel.

objects.name: Analisi Malware: Pygmy Goat
objects.description: This report contains technical analysis and indicators associated with malware. pygmy goat.
